    • Method Detail

      • isClosed

        public java.lang.Boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Closed.

        A Closed trade is one which has been completed or declined. That is, a Closed trade can no longer be interacted with.

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Closed. Returns false otherwise.

      • isPending

        public java.lang.Boolean isPending()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Pending.

        A pending trade is one which has been offered, but not accepted nor declined by the owner. That is, a pending trade is waiting to be interacted with by the other party.

        Specified by:
        isPending in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Pending. Returns false otherwise.

      • isEditable

        public java.lang.Boolean isEditable()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Editable.

        An editable trade is one which has not yet been offered.

        Specified by:
        isEditable in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Editable. Returns false otherwise.

      • isPublic

        public java.lang.Boolean isPublic()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Public A public trade is one which which has at least been offered. That is, a public trade is one which should be viewable by other users.
        Specified by:
        isPublic in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Public. Returns false otherwise.

      • offer

        public void offer(Trade trade)
           throws IllegalTradeStateTransition
        Offer a trade.

        A trade can only be offered if it is currently being composed, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateComposing.

        Specified by:
        offer in interface TradeState
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be offered.

        public void accept(Trade trade)

        Accept a trade.

      • getInterfaceString

        public java.lang.String getInterfaceString(java.lang.Boolean currentUserIsOwner)
        Returns a string for the interface. It will be displayed in combination with a username in the context of the original item which the borrower proposed the trade for. It must be a past-tense verb phrase. The first word must be capitalized. The subject of the verb is the original item which the borrower proposed the trade for. The receiver of the verb is the username. The passed parameter indicates whether the current user owns the item or not. Implementers must return a different string depending on whether the current user is the owner or not. The full interface string will be constructed as "[interfaceString] [username]".
        Specified by:
        getInterfaceString in interface TradeState

      • getStateString

        public java.lang.String getStateString()
        Description copied from interface: TradeState
        Returns a string representing the state. This should be the name of the state, eg "Completed", "Accepted". The first letter should be capitalized.
        Specified by:
        getStateString in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        The string representing the state.
